wp4.perfusion_machine.models¶

Classes

CreatedByModelMixin(*args, **kwargs) Helper Meta model in the same vein as VersionControlModel, but simpler.
PerfusionFile(*args, **kwargs) Early plans talked about collecting the data file from each machine after each transplant to provide extra data, however this has been shelved as a concept presently.
PerfusionMachine(*args, **kwargs) Helper class for device accountability.
User(*args, **kwargs) Users within the Django authentication system are represented by this model.
class wp4.perfusion_machine.models.CreatedByModelMixin(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Helper Meta model in the same vein as VersionControlModel, but simpler. Needs further work to refine the idea and to apply it more widely

TODO: Move this to Core, and account for setting created_by in the save method

created_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class wp4.perfusion_machine.models.PerfusionMachine(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Helper class for device accountability. Tracks actual Perfusion Machines used in the trial.

Parameters:

PerfusionMachine.created_by¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

PerfusionMachine.get_next_by_created_on(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
PerfusionMachine.get_previous_by_created_on(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
PerfusionMachine.organ_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

PerfusionMachine.perfusionfile_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class wp4.perfusion_machine.models.PerfusionFile(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Early plans talked about collecting the data file from each machine after each transplant to provide extra data, however this has been shelved as a concept presently. This class was the foundation of supporting that activity

Parameters:
  • id (django.db.models.AutoField) – “ID”
  • created_on (django.db.models.DateTimeField) – “created on”
  • created_by_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “created by”
  • machine_id (django.db.models.ForeignKey) – “PF01 perfusion machine”
  • file (django.db.models.FileField) – “file”
machine¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

file¶

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Returns a FieldFile when accessed so you can do stuff like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assigns a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world', 'r') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception PerfusionFile.MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.
